substeps.title: Confirm the Prescription
substeps.moreInfo: Check drug name, dose, route, frequency, and infusion duration against the MAR.
substeps.description: Review the antibiotic order and compare it with the patient’s MAR to ensure accuracy.

substeps.title: Assess Patient Allergies and IV Site
substeps.description: Ask the patient about known drug allergies, inspect the existing peripheral IV site for patency, redness, or infiltration.

substeps.title: Gather Supplies
substeps.moreInfo: IV antibiotic vial/bag, syringe with blunt‑fill needle, 0.9 % saline flush, alcohol swabs, gloves, IV tubing, pump (if used).
substeps.description: Collect all necessary items before entering the room to minimize delays.

substeps.title: Reconstitute or Dilute the Antibiotic
substeps.moreInfo: Follow manufacturer guidelines for diluent volume and compatibility.
substeps.description: Using aseptic technique, draw up diluent, inject into the vial, gently swirl until dissolved, and transfer to the IV bag or syringe.

substeps.title: Spike the Bag and Remove Air
substeps.description: Insert the spike into the bag port, invert the bag, and allow fluid to fill and purge air from the tubing.

substeps.title: Disinfect the IV Port
substeps.moreInfo: Use 70 % alcohol for at least 15 s; allow to dry.
substeps.description: Scrub the peripheral IV hub or port vigorously before connection.

substeps.title: Program the IV Pump (or Set Drip Rate)
substeps.moreInfo: Typical infusion times range from 15 min to 2 h depending on the antibiotic.
substeps.description: Enter total volume and time on the pump, or adjust roller clamp for gravity infusion per calculated drops/min.

substeps.title: Monitor Patient and Site
substeps.moreInfo: Observe for pain, swelling, rash, or anaphylaxis during the first 5 min.
substeps.description: Remain with the patient briefly, then check vitals and site at least every 15 min until completion.

substeps.title: Flush and Secure Line
substeps.description: Disconnect tubing, flush the catheter with 5–10 mL normal saline, and cap or resume primary fluids as ordered.

substeps.title: Document Administration
substeps.description: Record start/stop times, dose, lot number, patient response, and IV site assessment in the EMR.
